front.title: IANA Reserved IPv4 Prefix for IPv6 Transition

abstract.t: This document specifies the use of a Reserved IANA allocation for the purpose of dual-stack deployment post IPv4 exhaustion. Service providers are in the process of implementing IPv6 support by providing dual-stack IPv4 and IPv6 services to their end-users. One method for continued support of the IPv4 Internet post IANA IPv4 depletion is through the use of a carrier-provided NAT444 infrastructure. This document details the use of an IANA reserved block for this purpose.
